awd_titl_txt: Conference on "Danger Risk and Safety in Industrial and     Industrializing Societies,".  Hagley Museum, Wilmington, DE,Oct. 13-14, 1993
awd_abstract_narration: 9310717  Johnson  This award provides partial support for participants to attend a  conference and discuss research ideas and results on the topic of  "Danger, Risk and Safety:  Ideas and Practices in Industrializing  Societies."  The conference will occur at the Hagley Museum and  Library in Wilmington, Delaware.  The Center for the History of  Business, Technology, and Society at the museum, and the Society  for the History of Technology and the American Association for  the History of Medicine are co-sponsoring the conference.  Penn  State Press has expressed interest in publishing the papers.  The  conference will bring together scholars from a variety of  backgrounds to share ideas about the historical construction of  the concept of risk and its current policy implications and to  consider directions for future research.  Despite increasing  social attention to questions of risk and safety, and changing  conceptions and expectations about social attempts to deal with  these dangers, the historical study of risk remains a relatively  neglected area of scholarship.  Isolation within historical  specializations of labor, technology, or occupational health  results in little in the way of synthetic overview of the topic.   This conference will help to forge connections between graduate  students and established scholars in a variety of these  specialities, and to create a richer and more focussed exchange  on these issues.  ***
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
